messages: b58228eda77981a3cab2e04a151f7ef9 (20:20): How do I have Solaris halt if it panics, instead of reboot?  It's panicing on startup at the moment, but reboots far too quickly for me to note down any useful information to troubleshoot.
b58228eda77981a3cab2e04a151f7ef9 (20:21): asyd: Yes
631e53f91030c509ce45bb16bd235cdd (20:21): http://blogs.sun.com/roller/page/dmick?entry=diagnosing_kernel_hangs_panics_with
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (20:21): anyway try a memory check (like memtest86)
b58228eda77981a3cab2e04a151f7ef9 (20:22): Ta.  Boots in to failsafe mode with no problems.
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (20:23): my system is running "slowly"
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (20:24): it's taking apps (text editor, archive manager, ...) ages (5-15mins?) to open
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (20:24): (terminal atm)
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (20:24): once terminal actually launches, how can i find out why everything is slower than molases? :(
b58228eda77981a3cab2e04a151f7ef9 (20:25): Hmm.  That's a start.  Now I need to read the stuff that's scrolled off the screen
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (20:29): my terminal just opened :(
b58228eda77981a3cab2e04a151f7ef9 (20:37): kmdb documentation says that output is automatically sent via a pager.  This does not seem to be the case for the initial backtrace.
b58228eda77981a3cab2e04a151f7ef9 (20:37): I've been spoiled by gdb
b58228eda77981a3cab2e04a151f7ef9 (20:37): There's a phrase I never thought I'd type
a73bfae8a670e49280572b9e691fb15d (20:38): Anyone who could clarify the state of creating iSCSI targets with Solarus 6/06?
b58b6da33b36acabd1b7a600410e5326 (20:38): IIRC iSCSI target mode hit Nevada too late to make 06/06
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (20:40): Express 6/06 is b40, the iscsi target went in after that.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (20:40): which implies *way* too late for 10 6/06.
a73bfae8a670e49280572b9e691fb15d (20:41): http://mail.opensolaris.org/pipermail/storage-discuss/2006-July/000223.html
a73bfae8a670e49280572b9e691fb15d (20:41): That just got me confused.
a73bfae8a670e49280572b9e691fb15d (20:41): I'm just being sleepy sorry.
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:48): sun_ssh_1.1 does not seem to reading PAM.. tempting to install OpenSSH
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:49): sshd    auth required           pam_radius_auth.so suppose to make ssh read pam_radius
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:49): i setup million of systems with this pam
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:49): but all with openssh
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:49): in openssh u have to say UsePAM yes and thats it
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (20:49): use "other" not "sshd"
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:50): mrdeviant: u sure? cuz i setup literally 300 servers with that config
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:52): mrdeviant: no go
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:52): with other even local passwd does not work
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:53): i am positive u want to use sshd or it will force other services to use same pam library
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (20:53): sunssh doesn't use the sshd entry
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:55): mrdeviant: what does it use? may be i can name it to that service
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:55): mrdeviant: does not sound kosher.. why would sunssh not use sshd as the service name
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (20:56): see http://docs.sun.com/app/docs/doc/816-5166/6mbb1kqhh?q=sshd-kbdint&a=view for the list of service names
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (20:56): it uses a diff service name for each ssh user auth type
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (20:57): but to setup kerberized logins for sunssh, i always use the other service.
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (20:59): mrdeviant: i dont see anything about diff service name.. hmm
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (21:00): uh. it's in the Security section
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (21:00): see the big table that lists the sshd-none, sshd-password, sshd-kdbint, sshd-pubkey, sshd-hostbased, sshd-gssapi  services
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (21:01): anyway i have to run to lunch. be back later
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (21:02): i see so i should use sshd-kbdint
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (21:02): instead of sshd
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (21:03): its working
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (21:03): excellent
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (21:03): mrdeviant: u da man
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (21:07): PSUdaemon: little too excited
937b33a70f768fe1c738c7c08e4a3269 (21:08): you have no idea...
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (21:08): PSUdaemon: i was talking about myself ;-)
